intro: Listrostachys ignoti, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plant is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It has adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, featuring succulent stems and deep root systems. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential use in xeriscaping.
